reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI say this pretty often, but this game is another argument for the need for a neutral" option on steam reviews
date: instead of just YES or NO. View this as a tentative YES
recommended:
leaning heavily towards NO for the state it's in right now. This game needs work. A lot of work. Also- some of the positive reviews are really fishy. First-time reviewers who are overly enthusiastic about a game they have .1 hours in. It reeks of friends + family reviews. One of them even has 'MUMMY' in their name. Review continues below:

The concept here is fantastic. It's sort of a blend of 'Battleblock Theater' and 'Mighty Quest For Epic Loot'. Build your 'pyramid' using blocks
voteText: etc- to try to prevent other players from making it to the end and stealing your treasure. Similarly

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There's a potentially fun game in here somewhere, but there's quite a bit that doesn't make this work overall, and makes it so that I can't recommend it, even in Early Access as it grows and develops.

The biggest problem, one that absolutely needs to be pointed out, is the auto-running. It absolutely kills the game for me, and makes even simple and easy levels frustrating. This does make timing more important, but the fact that it complicates basically everything else makes the experience unenjoyable. There are several moments where you have to mash back and forth on the arrow keys to time a jump across an obstacle, or even doing it between two different obstacles, because you can't stop running. The objective of the game then goes from scaling walls and avoiding obstacles to figuring out how to get around the auto-running to successfully navigate.

The controls are also a bit frustrating. Delay in inputs means you have to make yourself jump or turn earlier than you want to, which probably isn't that bad until you play a level where optimal timing is essential. It showcases the downsides really boldly. Wall-jumping is the absolute hardest thing to do, as you'll either not jump when you want to in some cases, or not go far enough to the other side of the wall. There's even a glitch where your mummy climbs an invisible wall all the way up to the ledge. It's frustrating and hard to really replicate; it just tends to happen. It's amusing at first as well, until you run into an obstacle or fall because of it, and you may not even realize what's happening at first. When you're wall-jumping to avoid obstacles, it's a run killer. And I don't usually feel like it's my fault when I die, unlike other hard games, because the controls don't feel responsive.

There are other small glitches and bugs that aren't bad on their own, but dampen the experience overall. More than once have I wall-jumped, only to jump through the wall into my death. Some cases, I'll land inside the wall and can move around and jump out. I had to quit the game and reboot it when I beat the tutorial because no menus would pop up for me otherwise. Collision detection seems finicky, as I'll apparently have gotten into an obstacle when it seems like I've cleared this. This is most evident with the crocodile pit, but I'm willing to excuse that as just needing to be extra sure I clear it.

There are good things however! I like the vibe and aesthetic of the game, and the music wasn't annoying like most games in this genre tend to be. While you can only really jump over obstacles, the variety of traps and the methods in which they kill (or even affect) you is pleasant and refreshing. The ability to complete challenges and earn stuff at a decent enough rate is appreciated if one doesn't want to purchase any of the microtransactions, so you don't feel like you're grinding just to grind. On smaller notes, I appreciate that not only can you reduce the quality of the game, but even at the lowest settings for quality, it still looks really nice. Except for some hiccups in the period between dying and resetting, the game runs really well on my piece-of-♥♥♥♥ computer.

The ability to play others' levels and rate them and compete on leaderboards for each level is appreciated, but there's a major problem here; you can't preview the map before playing. The most you get is around five seconds to survey the map, no matter how huge or littered with blocks/obstacles (and this includes the time it takes to zoom out to look at the map). You have to essentially dive into these maps blindly, and for maps that are either huge, complicated, or non-linear, this is a killer. I've quit maps several times because of this. Even something small like seeing a preview of the map before I play the level would help incredibly. It would also help so I know when to avoid levels that are essentially auto-completion or not designed well, and allow me to get the most out of the game.

Normally, this isn't the kind of game I'd play, but it's free and Early Access, so I decided to check it out. There's potential, and tightened up and improved on more, I could see myself coming back to this every once in a while to enjoy. But at this stage, I simply can't recommend it.

Other suggestions/nitpicks:
Please get rid of that slow clapping when you complete a level. It's really annoying.
Achievements are always nice!
A little more diversity in the music so I don't feel like I'm tuning out.
Labeled menus. I could hardly tell what button to click because none of them were labeled or told me what to do or what function they had.
Level of the Day/Week, something to emphasize the community's creations more.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Free PC alternative for Super Mario Maker!

I like games where u can make levels for others to play. Also fan of platformer games.

PROS:
- Fun gameplay
- Player created levels
- Excellent level editor
- Various rewards (gold when others play your level, achivements...)

CONS:
- Very little socialization (no chat!)
- Could use more polish
- Bugs! Crashes! (It bugged and crashed for me atleast 20 times in my first day) (there is even a level called Error, that causes error when u play it xD )

Just need to get used to it and it rocks then! Must try if you like making levels

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The controls are flimsy, an uncomfortable cross between platformer and auto-running, and the delay on button presses utterly infuriating. The level editor is poorly implemented, leaving little incentive to try and make an interesting level: especially when the controls make the platforming such a chore in the first place. Menus are also unclear and mostly unlabled. Finally, the game gives you an utterly patronising slow clap when you complete a level: as if I wasn't unimpressed enough!

The concept is wonderful, but this game is woefully under-developed and not worth playing yet. There's no point in this being in early access, considering that a single-sentance pitch would actually promote this game better. Terribly disappointing.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is a cute game. Though I didn't want to mess with the other half of it (the player/build-your-own sections), I enjoyed the developer levels available. I appreciate not having the auto run and the controls were fairly intuitive. I notice a lot of people complaining about the view. I think it is a good distance, though I will admit I exited out of a level or two so that I could see the whole layout of the level again. If the object is to get a quick idea and then stumble your way through a trap-filled maze, this works very well. However, if it's just to get through the levels, it'd be nice to have a bring up the map" button--it could even keep the sand running. Other things to note: It was extremely frustrating to die merely touching the dropping foot
date: even if it wasn't dropping; there is a dun-dun-dun glitching sort of sound whenever I hit respawn; and it has cute artwork."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Just one more... Just one more...

This game seems quite light and easy at the start, but quickly sucks you in.

The preset maps give a good tutorial on effective map setup, and how various obstacles work (and kill you in amusing, yet infuriating ways).

The real draw is the ability to create and share maps, with the condition you complete your map before publishing, ensuring that it CAN be done, but also means there is tons to try out and if ones too hard, you can simply play others without being stuck.

Ive noticed others mentioning bugs, but encountered none myself, except for a slight delay when trying to walljump, but can be accounted for once you learn to expect it.

Also, sarcophagi are the worst

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI honestly believe this game has a lot of potential. I only have small things to pick on the developers about. I wish the view when running was a bit wider. The traps really aren't difficult to navigate. A lot of them just require you to jump. The only reason I ever really die is when they come on the screen to fast and I can't process it. It can get more annoying that difficult. I also don't like the auto-run thing you have going. It makes it harder for people to navigate some jumps and it would be better if you could easily control when you run and when you stop. Honestly, you just need something that will make a player have time to analyze a trap rather than it just appearing directly in front of you. Also, traps that you do more than just jump over. That's pretty much all I have to complain about. I really like the idea of the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I sometimes wish there was a neutral option in these reviews. This is one of those games. I can't really 'Recommend' it, but NOT recommending it, kinda makes you sound like an ♥♥♥, and it's free to play too, so..

Maybe it's not for anyone other than children at this point. Because there is really nothing in the game right now. You are a mummy and you just jump, jump, and then jump. And then finish the level. If you don't die, that is. So a child may have fun with it. But I don't see why anyone should kill their time with this right now.

I played the first 10 levels and then a bonus level. And I was pushing it. Having fun doesn't really describe it, it was more like ploughing through the levels and 'Let's get this done and out of the way' kind of experience.

So anyway, pros:

+ Character design is funny (mummies and ♥♥♥♥) (supposed to be scary but it's kind of funny)
+ Dying animations are funny
+ Music

That's about it really, now on to the cons:

- No content other than the foundation features of a platformer (jumping, dying, traps)
- Game feels kind of empty, because all you do is jump over the same obstacles over and over again,  trying not to die, and all for just reaching the end of the level. Then what? Next level. Wow exciting.
- Can be frustrating sometimes (for example, the character jumps excessively, making you jump INTO the traps on the walls. I think jumping needs to be toned down a bit.

***All in all, it's an early access game, so obviously there is going to be a lot of stuff added to the game in time. And that is why I'm not posting in the negative review pool. Because there is no solid reason for this game to be not recommended in the end.***

Sorry for the long review here is a cookie :sunspeed:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Decent idea with a god auful execution. Even for a an early access game, this game has ridiculous bugs that should have been fixed before going public. Bugs such as sometimes climbing up an invisible block while trying to walljump, or if you jump fast enough just going straight through the wall. All of this could be forgiven, but for some reason the creator decided to make you have to pay for items in the in game shop, but the only way to gain money is to play levels, or for people to beat yours. This creates two problems:
1. You start with hardly any money whatsoever. I think you get enough for 3 or 4 spikes. That's hardly enough to make a level that's difficult or interesting.
2. The fact that you gain money for simply having people beat your levels gives absolutely no inscentive for you to make them difficult, or even possible to fail. Why would you, when that only cuts down your profits. In the current version of the game, there is absolutely nothing stopping me from just making a level that has the start and exit next to each other. That is not good game design.

This game needs to be thoroughly improved before anyone should even consider playing it, never mind spending their hard earned cash on it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*Re-evaluated* This game has improved, and is much more playable. I am glad the auto-run mechanic is removed, and now most noticeable bugs have been fixed. I now recommend this new, free to play platformer, and enjoy it nowadays.


*** Old Review ***

Glitchy, unsynced and just god-awful in general. I know it's in early access, but it's so unfinished that it shouldn't be in early access. This needs a LOT of work. Sorry, but it's just a bad game in general. Unless you like glitchy and screwed up games, Pyramid Raid is for you. If you're sane, then avoid it at all costs.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game needs some work.  There is an annoying noise that sounds like a door shutting quickily after you hit respond.  The foot looking smashing poles kill you even just touch them.  They should only kill you when the slam down.  Also the view needs to be a little further out.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's fun, but I don't know if I would actually pay money for something like this. If they had a better level builder with more options I'd probably be building more than playing. Anyway, this game is fun to play if you have a 3 monitor setup.

reviewText:
Caution for positive reviews...
There was an update since December 2015 that changed this games business model, for the worst.
If you read some of the positive reviews about this game check if they mention this or free (its not anymore)
because yes they can still be true, they were for me once opon a time... but mostly wishfull thinking now :(


Since the update new players have to pay for the game(old player got it for free on their account)
And no more self builder levels and these where some of its best qualities.
The moment i write this i had 1.9 hrs on record, all fun.
Any increase will be for the remaining achivements (you want it because they are there)
Including: Play the game for a total of 10 hours

- About The game overall
The humour is nice for a while, certain kinds of death, but gets old realy quick
its a 2d platformer with an autorun that can get annoying real quick and can not be disabled
time record repley value

Conclusion this mummy should not be burries with a curse. doesnt work out that much
just rip is bandages, of until it spins to dust, and add fire to make sure or just to enjoy the show
And thats all he wrote. ;)

reviewText:
Ignore everything written underneath the line.

The game was changed from a F2P title to a paid game. But everything fun about it, especially the level editor was striped.Not even worth the 3 bucks it costs.


===== OLD REVIEW =====

Small nifty game with player constructed content.

Take the cons with a grain of salt, as it's an early access title and still in devlopment.

Pros:
- Level Editor with cool traps and effects
- Earning currency is easy
- Already some very cool player made levels
- The average rating discount system encourages good levels

Contras:
- Animations feel clunky, especially sliding and
- Controls don't feel sensitive enough for a fast paced jump 'n run
- Although earning money is easy, traps and non standard blocks cost too much which results in a lot of bland levels
- The level editor still needs some work (multi selection is not possible, GUI elements feel out of proportion)


I still enjoy the game and making levels for it.

reviewText: The game was free to play and was the only reason to play it. for a game it was sub standard and probably one of the worst free to play games out there. Now they remove the level editor and most of the game and want you to pay for it. If it was a better game i would pay for it but this is probably the worst game ive played the puzzles were terrible with no imagination in making them. The game now is not worth buying and shows how greedy developers can be specialy for a game thats only worth being released on Kongregate and not steam
